intro: Puccinellia airoides, commonly known as the smooth glassworts, is a flowering plant in the family Plantaginaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in saline or coastal environments, often found in wet meadows and salt marshes. The plant has slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are succulent and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Puccinellia airoides plays an important role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
